page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The name 'Kilndown' is ancient, but the village dates from the nineteenth century, when Lord Beresford of Bedgebury built the Church (1840) and Church Cottages, and his wife built the School (1846). So, most of the houses were built after that date, many by the Estates of Scotney, Bedgebury or the Crown. Since the war, some council houses and a small council estate have accounted for most of the Village. A limited amount of building is still going on, one house being completed earlier this year. There are several notable old houses. Twyssenden Manor is a fine timber building, until last year being a Youth Hostel. Twysden House dates from 1485, about the same date as Gatehouse (on sale for 385,000). Spelmonden was once the home of the ironmasters of the Horsmonden Furnace.
